title: Syrians Who Opposed Assad Fear Arrest as Troops Return
text:
When Aziz Dawood heard of the agreement struck by Kurdish forces to allow the Syrian government to return to the country’s northeast, he feared regime forces would raid his house that night as he slept to arrest him.

For years, living in a corner of Syria under Kurdish control, he and other government opponents have been beyond the reach of Syrian President Bashar al-Assad. Many joined antigovernment protests, dodged military conscription or took up arms against what they saw as a brutal police state.

...
description: Syrian opponents of Bashar al-Assad living in a once-sheltered enclave now fear arrest, and worse, after Kurdish-led forces allowed his troops to return to the country’s northeast.
